ygData.subject: RE: re:  gnome parties
ygData.msgSnippet: The monthly gnome party is a great idea!  Do it alphabetically perhaps.  I like Gnomestock, but can also call it GnoMania, GnomeBlitz or even GnomeFest.  Each
ygData.messageBody:
The monthly gnome party is a great idea! Do it alphabetically perhaps. I
like Gnomestock, but can also call it GnoMania, GnomeBlitz or even
GnomeFest. Each servers Gnomes (who volunteer) has the duty to setup
various small events (drinking parties, duels, how many gnomes fit in a
Kobald tent, etc). Should have a web page to see the server schedule for
these events. Anyway, I like this idea!

Kilkin

-----Original Message-----
From: Andy Smith [mailto:AndyS@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 21, 1999 4:21 PM
To: 'EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com'
Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] re: gnome parties

From: Andy Smith <AndyS@...>

Seeing all these responses to the party idea, I find myself
asking the
inevitable question: why not do a whole slew of parties?
We're all on
different servers so we can do a monthly gnomefest. Say the
first of each
month (since we're all so short) or if people find it easier
to accomodate
weekend schedules, the first Saturday of the month. Pick a
different server
every month. Maybe do some dueling competitions, some
drunken casting, some
minor illusion art etc. Perhaps see just how many level 1
chars it does
take to kill the mino hero (I'll bet on about 612, provided
at least 20 are
on him at a time)...

Just a thought. Preferably something that doesn't require a
lot of
preparations besides buying an insane amout of alcohol and a
little advance
warning to the GMs to let them know to expect heavy zone
loads.

What would we call it? Gnomapalooza? Gnomestock? Gnomes
are not Eunuchs
(that's one for you Gr0k)?
